quest.name: Worth a Candle
journal:
î‚¾ Quest Sync
Alsa is excited to see you.

dialogue.name: ALSA
dialogue.text: Ah, one of Master Matoya's guests. You've come at an opportune time.

dialogue.name: ALSA
dialogue.text: I was preparing to take a walk and tend to the candles about Slitherbough, and I would ask you assist me. I can think of no finer opportunity to learn more of our people.

dialogue.name: ALSA
dialogue.text: Take these three candles, and replace any that appear to be nearly spent. A simple task, I know, but I believe it will prove most illuminating.

dialogue.name: ALSA
dialogue.text: You need only place the three candles I gave you. I will take care of the rest.

dialogue.name: PRAYINGMAN03447
dialogue.text: A fresh candle. How thoughtful of you.

dialogue.name: PRAYINGMAN03447
dialogue.text: Whenever I'm feeling stressed, watching the flames helps settle my nerves. Something about the way they flicker and dance is so soothing to me. Perhaps you should give it a try sometime.

dialogue.name: PRAYINGMAN03447
dialogue.text: Pay me no mind. I'll be returning to work soon enough.

dialogue.name: HELPFULGIRL03447
dialogue.text: Thanks, missmister. You're real good at placing candles.

dialogue.name: HELPFULGIRL03447
dialogue.text: Mama says the night sky has candles. Lots and lots of candles. So many you can't count them all. I bet I could, though!

dialogue.name: HELPFULGIRL03447
dialogue.text: Have you seen the candles outside, in the sky? There's so many! Mama said there's too many to count, but I bet I could if I wanted.

dialogue.name: HELPFULGIRL03447
dialogue.text: They're really pretty, but I think I like the candles in here more.

dialogue.name: HELPFULGIRL03447
dialogue.text: Hey missmister, why do you dress so funny? Is it for your work? Mama makes medicine and Papa is a guard. He's always busy outside, so I try to help lots and lots inside.

dialogue.name: CANDLEWOMAN03447
dialogue.text: Beautiful, aren't they? Like the souls of the departed, burning bright in the sunless sea above.

dialogue.name: CANDLEWOMAN03447
dialogue.text: I often come here to pay respects to our forebears, reflecting on the sacrifices that allowed us to live as we do now.

dialogue.name: CANDLEWOMAN03447
dialogue.text: What do you see when you look into the flames?

dialogue.name: ALSA
dialogue.text: You are returned, and enlightened by the experience, I trust. We are a quiet people, but conversation comes easy in the presence of the candles.

dialogue.name: ALSA
dialogue.text: Before the Flood, our worship would no doubt have been seen as profane. Sacrilege...

dialogue.name: ALSA
dialogue.text: But it is the expression of our faith that defines us, not the object of our worship.

dialogue.name: ALSA
dialogue.text: I can but imagine what change may come to the Night's Blessed should the night ever return to us.

dialogue.name: ALSA
dialogue.text: I can but imagine what change will come to the Night's Blessed now that the night has returned to us.
